}} The '2006â07 Football League Cup' was the 47th staging of the Football League
Cup, a knockout competition for England's top 92 football clubs. The competition
name reflects a sponsorship deal with lager brand Carling.

The competition began in August 2006 and ended with the final on February 25,
2007. The Millennium Stadium in Cardiff hosted the final match, as it has done
since 2001 (the reconstruction of Wembley Stadium could not be completed in time
to host the final).

The winners were Chelsea, beating Arsenal in the final 2-1 after two goals by
Didier Drogba.
